alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 20 at 4:14PM AKDT until May 21 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT SATURDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a Red Flag Warning for hot, dry, windy conditions, which is in effect until 10 PM AKDT Saturday. * Winds...Southeast winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * TIMING...Now through 10 PM this evening; Noon to 10 PM Saturday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Temperatures...65 to 75 degrees. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest sustained winds, gusts, and lowest RH values are expected across the Anchorage Hillside, west and south Anchorage. Winds diminish overnight with some RH recovery. Winds are expected to become gusty out of the southeast again for similar areas Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening with low min RH values. Winds subside Saturday evening with some RH recovery overnight.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or occurring now, or will shortly. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public.
